Intro to GHPM

Harsh Baid

ghpm.Rmd

GHPM is an R Package designed to make grabbing data from a GitHub Repository and performing analytics easy. It does this by providing a set of flexible functions that query important aspects of a repository (pullrequests, commits, issues, etc..) via the GitHub API and pipes the output into dataframes.

We can then use the powerful data manipulation tools that dplyr provides to create a resulting dataframe of the information we want.

This document is designed to introduce you to some of these functions and the analytical data that can be extracted. To explore this functionality, we will be using RStudio’s Shiny repository to grab data from.

Issues

Lets start with grabbing issues from shiny repo using the following command.

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny")
#> # A tibble: 100 x 8
#>    issue title         body          creator  milestone state id      databaseId
#>    <dbl> <chr>         <chr>         <chr>    <chr>     <chr> <chr>        <int>
#>  1  2706 Not possible… "I'm not sur… daattali <NA>      OPEN  MDU6SX…  526219280
#>  2  2708 Should imple… MockShinySes… wch      1.5       OPEN  MDU6SX…  526875188
#>  3  2709 testModule i… "@jcheng5 po… alandip… <NA>      CLOS… MDU6SX…  528378270
#>  4  2710 "Error relat… "Hi All,\nI … davidlub <NA>      OPEN  MDU6SX…  528546888
#>  5  2711 autoreload d… "My R/ dir h… mik3y64  <NA>      OPEN  MDU6SX…  528618065
#>  6  2712 Using `testM… "module <- f… akgold   1.5       CLOS… MDU6SX…  528899496
#>  7  2715 “Not Found” … "I and anoth… pablobe… <NA>      CLOS… MDU6SX…  530754276
#>  8  2716 Shiny remove… I can't find… william… <NA>      CLOS… MDU6SX…  530864229
#>  9  2720 `sidebarPane… "System deta… andrewb… <NA>      CLOS… MDU6SX…  535066562
#> 10  2723 Progress bar… "progress <-… hadley   <NA>      OPEN  MDU6SX…  535752746
#> # … with 90 more rows

However, depending on the information I am looking for, I can further refine my request. If I only wanted issues from a particular milestone that were closed, I could do the following:

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(milestone == "0.9.0", state == "CLOSED")
#> # A tibble: 0 x 8
#> # … with 8 variables: issue <dbl>, title <chr>, body <chr>, creator <chr>,
#> #   milestone <chr>, state <chr>, id <chr>, databaseId <int>

or say I wanted to only get issues that a certain user created for a specific milestone

get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(creator == "HarlanH", milestone == "0.9.0")
#> # A tibble: 0 x 8
#> # … with 8 variables: issue <dbl>, title <chr>, body <chr>, creator <chr>,
#> #   milestone <chr>, state <chr>, id <chr>, databaseId <int>

I can get even more information by combining this query with other issue based queries. Like if I wanted to get the comments of all the issues created by user: HarlanH that were assigned in the 0.9.0 milestone, I could do:

HarlanH_issues <- get_issues("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(creator == "HarlanH", milestone == "0.9.0")

get_issue_comments("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(issue %in% HarlanH_issues$issue)
#> # A tibble: 0 x 6
#> # … with 6 variables: issue <int>, comment <chr>, author <chr>, date <dttm>,
#> #   id <chr>, databaseId <int>

The following functions are provided to grab issue data

  • get_issues() - Grabs general data about each issue
  • get_issue_labels() - Grabs the labels attached to each issue
  • get_issue_assignees() - Grabs assignees assigned to each issue
  • get_issue_events() - Queries event data specific to issues being added and moved across project boards for each issue
  • get_issue_comments() - Grabs the comment data for each issue.

Pull Requests

Pull requests is another area where GHPM has a lot of flexibility. To just grab some basic information about pull requests, I can do the following:

get_all_pull_requests("rstudio", "shiny")
#> # A tibble: 100 x 10
#>    pullrequest title author body  milestone created_at          merged_by
#>          <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>    
#>  1          12 fixe… jeffr… just… <NA>      2012-08-17 23:13:14 jcheng5  
#>  2          28 Chan… wch    Usin… <NA>      2012-10-30 15:50:29 jcheng5  
#>  3          32 "sma… edwin… "Hi … <NA>      2012-11-08 22:20:09 jcheng5  
#>  4          49 For … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-03 21:00:57 jcheng5  
#>  5          50 Use … wch    This… <NA>      2012-12-03 21:02:35 <NA>     
#>  6          51 Allo… wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-05 20:22:35 <NA>     
#>  7          62 Meth… wch    "Thi… <NA>      2012-12-19 19:52:32 <NA>     
#>  8          63 Wrap… wch    "The… <NA>      2012-12-20 06:37:09 <NA>     
#>  9          68 Add … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2013-01-04 21:49:29 <NA>     
#> 10          69 Fix … wch    "Thi… <NA>      2013-01-08 03:20:41 <NA>     
#> # … with 90 more rows, and 3 more variables: merged_at <dttm>, merged_to <chr>,
#> #   state <chr>

or a more refined search of pull requests grabbing the ones that were created by a specific user and merged.

pr <- get_all_pull_requests("rstudio", "shiny") %>% filter(author == "wch", state == "MERGED")

I can also grab the commit history of specific pull requests

get_pull_request_commits("rstudio", "shiny", 271)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 4
#>   oid               message                         author   date               
#>   <chr>             <chr>                           <chr>    <dttm>             
#> 1 aab2cce97858f9ac… Update to Bootstrap 2.3.2       Winston… 2013-10-15 17:13:34
#> 2 559c6722ff5741e9… Update NEWS                     Winston… 2013-10-15 20:24:02
#> 3 2e60f2b2ce8e040b… Update to jQuery 1.10.2         Winston… 2013-11-19 20:35:53
#> 4 9725b23db1588f61… Update NEWS                     Winston… 2013-11-19 20:36:21
#> 5 7ca22a8718928793… "Add updated version of jslide… Winston… 2013-11-19 22:36:39

and even have the option to parse them into a conventional commits format

get_pull_request_commits("rstudio", "shiny", 271, .cc = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 7
#>   oid         type  description    body       footer author  date               
#>   <chr>       <chr> <chr>          <chr>      <chr>  <chr>   <dttm>             
#> 1 aab2cce978… <NA>  Update to Boo… <NA>       <NA>   Winsto… 2013-10-15 17:13:34
#> 2 559c6722ff… <NA>  Update NEWS    <NA>       <NA>   Winsto… 2013-10-15 20:24:02
#> 3 2e60f2b2ce… <NA>  Update to jQu… <NA>       <NA>   Winsto… 2013-11-19 20:35:53
#> 4 9725b23db1… <NA>  Update NEWS    <NA>       <NA>   Winsto… 2013-11-19 20:36:21
#> 5 7ca22a8718… <NA>  Add updated v… This adds… <NA>   Winsto… 2013-11-19 22:36:39
